p: N 2O, as one of the GHGs, has gained worldwide attention, and has also been thoroughly assessed in China 9 10. It is well known that reducing N 2O emissions offers the combined benefits of mitigating climate change and protecting the ozone layer 10. The increasing demands for food and energy in China have led to ever-increasing emissions of NO x and NH 3 11. These short-lived Nr emissions have multiple and profound effects on climate, the environment and human health 12. However, their relevance to climate in China is still unclear in previous studies. In addition, ecosystem N availability strongly affects the terrestrial net C balance 13, as well as many other ecosystem services associated with environmental quality 14. The terrestrial ecosystem C balance in China was investigated to under the influence of multiple global change factors 15 16. The effects of N deposition and N fertilizer use have been identified in a few studies 17 18.
